Uses of Class
org.jamwiki.parser.ParserException

  • Packages that use ParserException 
    Package Description
    org.jamwiki
    The org.jamwiki package contains the core interfaces and classes needed for JAMWiki to function.
    org.jamwiki.parser
    The org.jamwiki.parser package contains the interfaces, abstract classes, and utility classes needed to implement a parser for JAMWiki.
    org.jamwiki.parser.bliki
    Provides an alternative parser for JAMWiki, developed with the Bliki Java Wikipedia API.
    org.jamwiki.parser.image  

    • Uses of ParserException in org.jamwiki

      Methods in org.jamwiki that throw ParserException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String JAMWikiParser.parseEditComment(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw)
      Parse an edit comment and return HTML for online representation.
      String JAMWikiParser.parseFragment(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw, int mode)
      This method parses content, performing all transformations except for layout changes such as adding paragraph tags.
      String JAMWikiParser.parseHTML(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw)
      Returns a HTML representation of the given wiki raw text for online representation.
      void JAMWikiParser.parseMetadata(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw)
      This method provides a way to parse content and set all output metadata, such as link values used by the search engine.
      String JAMWikiParser.parseMinimal(ParserInput parserInput, String raw)
      Perform a bare minimum of parsing as required prior to saving a topic to the database.
      String JAMWikiParser.parseSlice(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw, int targetSection)
      When making a section edit this function provides the capability to retrieve all text within a specific heading level.
      String JAMWikiParser.parseSplice(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String raw, int targetSection, String replacementText)
      This method provides the capability for re-integrating a section edit back into the main topic.

    • Uses of ParserException in org.jamwiki.parser

      Subclasses of ParserException in org.jamwiki.parser 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ExcessiveNestingException
      Custom exception class used to indicate that the parser has nested too deeply and may be in an infinite loop.
      Methods in org.jamwiki.parser that throw ParserException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String LinkUtil.buildExternalLinkHtml(String link, String cssClass, String linkText)
      Parse a link of the form http://example.com and return the opening tag of the form <a href="http://example.com">.
      static String LinkUtil.interwiki(WikiLink wikiLink)
      Generate the HTML for an interwiki anchor link.
      static String ParserUtil.parse(ParserInput parserInput, ParserOutput parserOutput, String content)
      Using the system parser, parse system content.
      static String ParserUtil.parseEditComment(ParserInput parserInput, String content)
      Using the system parser, parse an edit comment.
      static ParserOutput ParserUtil.parseMetadata(ParserInput parserInput, String content)
      This method provides a way to parse content and set all output metadata, such as link values used by the search engine.
      static String ParserUtil.parseMinimal(ParserInput parserInput, String raw)
      Perform a bare minimum of parsing as required prior to saving a topic to the database.
      static ParserOutput ParserUtil.parserOutput(String content, String virtualWiki, String topicName)
      Retrieve a default ParserOutput object for a given topic name.
      static String ParserUtil.parserRedirectContent(String topicName)
      Given a topic name, return the parser-specific syntax to indicate a page redirect.
      static String[] ParserUtil.parseSlice(String context, Locale locale, String virtualWiki, String topicName, int section)
      When editing a section of a topic, this method provides a way of slicing out a given section of the raw topic content.
      static String[] ParserUtil.parseSplice(ParserOutput parserOutput, String context, Locale locale, String virtualWiki, String topicName, int targetSection, String replacementText)
      When editing a section of a topic, this method provides a way of splicing an edited section back into the raw topic content.
